abstracts.cdata!:
The fundamental objectives of the
            project would be to strengthen the government
            institutions/agencies which have a central role to play in
            the reform effort, by creating an effective and efficient
            enabling environment in support of private sector
            development, and to finance the needed technical help to the
            extent that financing cannot be obtained from other sources
            on concessional terms.  The project would finance
            multi-sectoral activities to support the Government in the
            implementation of its economic reform program. It would
            consist of technical assistance through the financing of
            resident advisors and short-term consultants, studies,
            training and limited amounts of equipment in the following
            areas : a) private sector development, enterprise
            privatization and restructuring; b) bank restructuring and
            reform, including restructuring of the banking system; c)
            human resource development and strengthening of the social
            safety net, including modernization of the social security
            and welfare system; d) energy sector strategy reforms,
            through studies of the power generation sector, the
            potential for expansion of the use of gas, and the safety
            and environmental aspects of the use of nuclear power; and
            e) institutional development to support activities critical
            to the reform, including : i) international trade reform;
            ii) support in the design of a debt strategy; and iii) an
            assessment of the computerization needs of the Central
            Statistics Office.
